There are numerous ways to increase community involvement in local decision-making. Here are eight effective strategies:

1. Community Meetings: Regularly hold open forums or town hall meetings where community members can ask questions and give input on various local issues. Promote the events via social media, flyers, and word of mouth.

2. Surveys and Polls: Conduct surveys or polls to get specific feedback from your residents on a range of topics such as education, health care availability, transportation infrastructure, housing options or recreational areas.

3. Establish Committees: Create advisory committees made up of diverse groups that represent different demographics in the community (senior citizens, single parents/similar family structure series etc..) These committees will help assess needs within these targeted communities so as to adequately address them when making decisions concerning these needs.

4. Get Online: Make it easy for residents by providing accessible online communication tools such as email listings/listservs containing information about ongoing projects/initiatives/timelines specific genre-focused FB pages/websites have sections dedicated solely citizen concerns via message boards/blogs provide regular updates developments/pending legislation affected parties apps usage wherein pertinent news may be sent directly end-users mobile devices possible
